javadoc:
LocalFolderItem provides an abstract implementation of a folder item which resides on a local file-system. An item is defined by a property file and generally has a hidden data directory which contains the actual data file(s).

An item may be either private or shared (i.e., versioned) as defined by the associated file-system. A shared item utilizes a CheckoutManager and HistoryManager for tracking version control data related to this item.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct an existing item which corresponds to the specified 
 property file.  If a data directory is found it will be 
 associated with this item.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Constructor for a new or existing item which corresponds to the specified 
 property file.

params.name: useDataDir
params.comment:
if true the getDataDir() method must return an appropriate 
 directory for data storage.

params.name: create
params.comment: if true the data directory will be created

methods.javadoc: Returns hidden database directory
methods.name: getDataDir

methods.javadoc:
Return the oldest/minimum version.
@throws IOException thrown if an IO error occurs.
methods.name: getMinimumVersion

throws.comment: thrown if an IO error occurs.

methods.name: checkInUse
methods.comment: Verify that the specified version of this item is not in use.

params.name: version
params.comment: the specific version to check for versioned items.

methods.javadoc:
Verify that this item is not in use.
@throws FileInUseException
methods.name: checkInUse
methods.comment: Verify that this item is not in use.

methods.name: beginCheckin
methods.comment: Begin the check-in process for a versioned item.

params.name: checkoutId
params.comment: assigned at time of checkout, becomes the check-in ID.

methods.javadoc:
Terminates a check-in which is in progress or has been completed.
@param itemCheckinId used to validate termination request.
methods.name: endCheckin
methods.comment: Terminates a check-in which is in progress or has been completed.

methods.javadoc: Send out notification this item has just been created.

methods.comment: Send out notification this item has just been created.

methods.javadoc: Send out notification that this item has changed in some way.

methods.comment: Send out notification that this item has changed in some way.

methods.javadoc: Abort the creation of
methods.name: abortCreate

methods.javadoc: @see ghidra.framework.store.FolderItem#delete(int, java.lang.String)
methods.name: delete

methods.javadoc:
Remove this item from the associated filesystem.
 The property file and the hidden data directory are removed.
 If in-use files prevent removal a FileInUseException will be thrown.
@param user user performing removal
@throws IOException if an error occurs during the delete operation.
 Files are restored to there original state if unable to remove
 all files.
methods.name: deleteContent
methods.comment:
Remove this item from the associated filesystem.
 The property file and the hidden data directory are removed.
 If in-use files prevent removal a FileInUseException will be thrown.

throws.comment:
if an error occurs during the delete operation.
 Files are restored to there original state if unable to remove
 all files.

methods.name: deleteMinimumVersion
methods.comment:
Delete the item content associated with the minimum version.
 This method will only be invoked for versioned items and will
 never be the only version (i.e., minVersion will always be less
 than the currentVersion).

methods.name: deleteCurrentVersion
methods.comment:
Delete the item content associated with the current version.
 This method will only be invoked for versioned items and will
 never be the only version (i.e., minVersion will always be less
 than the currentVersion).

methods.name: moveTo
methods.comment: Move this item into a newFolder which has a path of newPath.

getFolderItem
methods.comment:
Returns the appropriate instantiation of a LocalFolderItem 
 based upon a specified property file which resides within a
 LocalFileSystem.

params.name: fileSystem
params.comment: local file system which contains property file

params.name: propertyFile
params.comment: property file which identifies the folder item.

methods.name: updateCheckout
methods.comment: Update this non-versioned item with the latest version of the specified versioned item.

params.name: versionedFolderItem
params.comment:
versioned item which corresponds to this
 non-versioned item.

params.name: updateItem
params.comment: if true this items content is updated using the versionedFolderItem

throws.comment:
if this file is not a checked-out non-versioned file 
 or an IO error occurs.

methods.name: updateCheckout
methods.comment:
Update this non-versioned item with the contents of the specified item which must be 
 within the same non-versioned fileSystem.  If successful, the specified item will be 
 removed after its content has been moved into this item.

throws.comment:
if this file is not a checked-out non-versioned file 
 or an IO error occurs.

name: LocalFolderItem
comment:
LocalFolderItem provides an abstract implementation of a folder
 item which resides on a local file-system.  An item is defined by a property file
 and generally has a hidden data directory which contains the actual data file(s).

 An item may be either private or shared (i.e., versioned) as defined by the
 associated file-system.  A shared item utilizes a CheckoutManager and HistoryManager
 for tracking version control data related to this item.
